Overview
p

We're looking for a Head of Engineering. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We‚Äôre in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
engagement-details
Engagement Details

We're expanding financial access across the globe. Small businesses drive the economy. They deserve to own a piece of it. We give entrepreneurs anywhere in the world power to control their financial destiny. üí∏
We provide blockchain-based financing and other flexible financial services to businesses in emerging markets and rewards them with ownership, enabling them to create wealth and prosperity for themselves and their communities, who have long been underserved or exploited by financial institutions. üîë
We‚Äôre a fun-loving team split across LA, NYC, Nairobi, Manila, and Bangalore. We are backed by leading fintech and crypto investors including TCG Crypto, BlockTower Capital, Saison Capital, Draft Ventures, Hashed Emergent, Flori Ventures, Global Coin Research, and prominent angels like Packy McCormick, Anand Iyer, Kinjal Shah, and Jared Hecht. üåèüåçüåé

Working directly with the founders
Working in a mission-based company in the early stages
Making meaningful things at the global scale
Fully own engineering
whats-in-it-for-you
What‚Äôs in it for you
1. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company
2. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you‚Äôre in control of your own schedule
4. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.
required-qualifications
Required Qualifications
Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.
5+ years of full-time hands-on experience with Engineering Management.
3+ years of full-time hands-on experience Managing Managers.
Experience and successful track record of executing a product roadmap.
Ability to hire and expand the engineering team.
nice-to-haves
Nice to Haves
Startup experience
Chinese language proficiency or experience working with Chinese software development firms
Flutter experience
Java experience
Scala experience
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated ability.
frequently-asked-questions
Frequently Asked Questions
blockquote
em
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That‚Äôs where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your engagements?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.
What‚Äôs your company size?

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 100 by the end of the year. The current client-size team is 19+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we‚Äôll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?
Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
Quality: we‚Äôre passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

60% of your time will be spent on invoicing, payments, and bookkeeping

Senior Fullstack Engineer - Javascript
Senior
Fullstack Engineer
Javascript
account-details

We're looking for a Senior Fullstack Engineer - Javascript in Mexico City. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance provides top-tier technology talent for innovative companies in the US. We‚Äôre in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

Our client is a fast-paced, high-growth startup, committed to transforming a $30-billion industry through their  all-in-one platform. Leveraging the latest technology, They‚Äôre taking commercial contractors from the world of pen and paper operations to digitized, efficient and data-driven business.
The co-founders have over a decade of experience in both construction and SaaS technology, as well as a resume that includes Stanford, Harvard, Wharton, Cornell, Microsoft, and multiple successful startup exits, including a $1.2 billion acquisition.
Our client has raised multiple rounds of funding from some of the largest and most reputable Venture Capital firms, including Founders Fund, Fika Ventures, and Greenspring Associates.
Our engineering team is distributed across Los Angeles, Toronto, and Latin America. As a pioneering member of the team, your primary focus will be to help continue to build the product from the ground up. We are looking for a motivated, self-starter who can work in a distributed team environment. This is a hands-on role. The day-to-day responsibilities are broad, and you will ultimately be responsible for delivering software.
NOTE: To qualify, you need to live in or move into Mexico City, and be ok with a hybrid work environment working in the office 2-3 days per week.

We're starting a new office in Mexico City. Be one of the first engineers to establish a strong engineering culture at this location.
We're using Javascript across the stack. Our backend is in Node.js, frontend is in React.js and React Native, GraphQL and Apollo for the API layer. There is greenfield development of new product modules using the latest technologies, libraries, and tools.
As a Senior Full-Stack Engineer, you will:
Write quality code with 80%+ code coverage, and thoroughly documented.
Develop, support, and improve our GraphQL API.
Build and maintain real-time, event-driven systems, services, and features.
Create new components and improve existing components in our React component library.
Teach and enforce documentation standards.
Propose recommendations, build prototypes, and provide feedback.
Work with the QA engineering team.
Own the short-and-long term technical vision of your squad.
Be responsible for all major technical decisions for your squad and be able to influence the decisions of your team without having to make all of them.
Provide technical mentorship and guidance to engineers within your team and others.
Help improve the technical quality of our work through regular technical design and code reviews.
Share your technical knowledge and expertise.
Communicate effectively with engineers, product managers, customers, partners, and other leaders.
Flexible hours. Join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that, you‚Äôre in control of your own schedule.
5+ years of full-time hands-on Software Engineering experience.
5+ years of full-time hands-on Node.js API backend experience.
3+ years of full-time hands-on React.js experience.
Experience being a role model to more junior engineers as an individual contributor.
Being able to guide the technology decisions of your squad, while contributing alongside them.
Writing modern JavaScript/ECMAScript code that is clean, well-tested, and reusable.
Experience in Senior Engineering roles (designing APIs, abstractions, and tools used by other engineers).
Strong communication and technical writing skills.
React Native experience or being open to learning it quickly.
Material-UI experience or being open to learning it quickly.
Prior knowledge or ability to quickly learn developing in a CI/CD environment.
Prior knowledge or familiarity with Python for back-end development is a plus.
Familiarity with Jest, unit testing, debugging, profiling, and performance monitoring.
B.S., M.S., or PhD from a top university in computer science, engineering, or related fields.

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. The current client size team is 246+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.

/opportunities/senior-seo-manager-220
Senior SEO Manager
Senior SEO
Manager
monitor-dashboard

We're looking for a Senior SEO Manager. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance provides top-tier technology talent for innovative companies in the US. We‚Äôre in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

We're a USA-based company producing video solutions with the mission to advance scientific research and education. Our institutional clients comprise over 1,000 universities, colleges, and biopharma companies, including such leaders as Harvard, MIT, Yale, and Stanford. As a rapidly growing company, with offices in the USA, UK, Australia, and India servicing clients in over 60 countries, we are seeking talented individuals to join our company.
You'll have a tremendous impact on the bottom line of the business. A lot of our traffic is organic, and our SEO needs to be spot-on. You'll oversee all aspects of SEO for all of our products and domains. As the Sr. SEO Manager, you'll work across all teams to develop and implement strategies to improve online visibility, rankings, conversions, and ROI by optimizing our content and website structure. We're an established company and have been in the market for 17+ years. Now, we need you to take it to the next level.
What you'll do:
Develop a holistic SEO strategy that grows organic search traffic and conversions and aligns with the overall company goals and priorities; execute the roadmap; and track performance.

Proactively test, analyze, and make changes to product domains to ensure they are optimized for search engines and rank higher in the search results on major search engines (e.g., Google, Google Scholar, Bing).
Conduct regular website audits to identify areas for improvement and implement necessary changes.

Contribute SEO expertise to the overall website strategy and collaborate with other departments within the company, such as Marketing, Sales, Business Development, Technology, and Product, to ensure content and overall Information Architecture drive relevant traffic by meeting search intent.
Collaborate with the Engineering team to implement SEO-friendly technical changes (e.g., optimize for Web Vitals, add appropriate schema).
Define, tune, execute, and capitalize on content gaps with our competitors, content growth, and content optimization opportunities.
Keep ahead of the newest SEO strategies, techniques, and best practices to improve our SEO strategies continuously.
Discover link opportunities through competitive backlink research via tools such as Majestic SEO, Ahrefs, Open Site Explorer, and SEM Rush.
Monitor and report key performance indicators such as indexing, rankings, backlinks, and SERP click-through rates.
8+ years of full-time hands-on SEO experience.
3+ years of full-time hands-on SEO Manager/Lead experience.
High level of attention to detail and extreme focus on quality of results (essential).
Strong SEO knowledge and the ability to translate complex topics for a non-technical audience.
Experience analyzing data, finding insights, and presenting findings to internal and/or external stakeholders, including at the executive level.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to drive meaningful actions from large data sets.
Experience with SEO and website analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, SEMRush, Ahrefs, Google Search Console, Lighthouse, Pagespeed Insight, etc.).
Demonstrated ability to keep current with trends and technological advancements in SEO, UI/UX, Google algorithm updates, etc.
Ability to manage time and organize projects; works well under pressure and can meet strict deadlines.
Experience interacting with customers, senior executives, and business leaders.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and follow through to ensure timely completion.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to consult on projects and present information effectively.
Knowledge of conversion optimization principles and techniques.
Experience with Ed-Tech, Journal, and Research market-specific search engines such as Google Scholar, Google Books, Web of Science, Scopus, Paperpile, etc.
Previous experience with SEM and social media marketing is a plus.

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. The current client size team is 548+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.
